metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34903 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GnuPG through 2.3.6, in unusual situations where an attacker possesses any secret-key information from a victim's keyring and other constraints (e.g., use of GPGME) are met, allows signature forgery via injection into the status line.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dirmngr - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gnupg - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gnupg-agent - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gnupg-l10n - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gnupg-utils - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gnupg2 - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpg - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpg-agent - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpg-wks-client - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpg-wks-server - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpgconf - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpgsm - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpgv - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpgv-static - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpgv-win32 - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
gpgv2 - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
scdaemon - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> issue may not be as severe in gnupg 1

criterions.comment: gnupg2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2').
